abstract: Supreme Court hears arguments in death penalty case involving intellectually disabled inmate Kevan Brumfield of Louisiana; rules that requiring convicted sex offender Torrey Dale Grady to wear GPS device for rest of his life amounts to search under Fourth Amendment, returning case to lower court; rules against Michigan inmate Cory Donald, serving life sentence for killing drug dealer, who had argued he was denied effective representation.
lead_paragraph: The Supreme Court also ruled on two other cases, one involving ankle bracelets and the other regarding a convicted killer’s representation.

headline.main: Justices Hear Arguments on Intellectual Disability in Death Penalty Case
headline.print_headline: Inmate Claims Disability in Battle Over Execution

snippet: The Supreme Court also ruled on two other cases, one involving ankle bracelets and the other regarding a convicted killer’s representation.
